https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin, or in one or more cavities of the body.

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin, or in one or more cavities of the body.

definition.value: Edema may be related to one or more of the following factors: 1) increased capillary hydrostatic pressure, 2) decreased osmotic pressure of plasma, 3) decreased tissue tension and lymphatic drainage, 4) increased osmotic pressure of tissue fluids, and 5) increased capillary permeability.

Derinin normalden daha fazla gerilebildiği ve ilk pozisyonuna geri döndüğü bir durumdur

value.value: Stav, ve kterém je kůže roztažitelná víc než je normální, a následně se vrátí do své původní polohy

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A condition in which the skin can be stretched beyond normal, and then returns to its initial position.

definition.value: Skin hyperelasticity is to be distinguished from cutis laxa, which refers to extra, redundant skin which tends to hang in folds.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0000975 (Hyperhidrosis)  ; abnormality of the integument

value.value: Abnormal excessive perspiration (sweating) despite the lack of appropriate stimuli like hot and humid weather.
Abnormální nadměrné pocení i přes nedostatek způsobujících podnětů jako teplé a vlhké počasí

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Abnormal excessive perspiration (sweating) despite the lack of appropriate stimuli like hot and humid weather.

value.value: Aşırı sıcak ve nemli hava gibi uygun bir uyaran olmamasına rağmen anormal aşırı terleme (perspirasyon)

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Abnormal excessive perspiration (sweating) despite the lack of appropriate stimuli like hot and humid weather.

definition.value: The terms hyperhidrosis and diaphoresis are often used interchangeably to describe excessive perspiration. Diaphoresis can be used to refer to excessive sweating that occurs with certain diseases (secondary hyperhidrosis). Since the HPO does not intend to provide coess for etiologies or diseases, we will use these terms interchangeably to refer to excessive perspiration without an appropriate cause such as hot and humid weather.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0000978 (Bruising susceptibility)  ; abnormality of the integument ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system ; abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues

value.value: An ecchymosis (bruise) refers to the skin discoloration caused by the escape of blood into the tissues from ruptured blood vessels. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to bruising. The corresponding phenotypic abnormality is generally elicited on medical history as a report of frequent ecchymoses or bruising without adequate trauma.
Ekchymóza (modřina) je zabarvení kůže způsobené únikem krve do tkání s protrženými krevními cévami. Tento termín se vztahuje k abnormálně zvýšené citlivosti na vznik modřin bez adekvátního traumatu

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: An ecchymosis (bruise) refers to the skin discoloration caused by the escape of blood into the tissues from ruptured blood vessels. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to bruising. The corresponding phenotypic abnormality is generally elicited on medical history as a report of frequent ecchymoses or bruising without adequate trauma.

value.value: Ekimoz (bere) kanın yırtılan kan damarlarından doku içine kaçması ile oluşan derinin renk değiştirmesidir. Bu terim berelenmeye anormal şekilde olan yatkınlık artışını açıklamaktadır. Buna karşılık gelen fenotipik anormallik genellikle sık ekimozlar veya yeterli travma olmadan gerçekleşen tıbbi hikaye ile açıklığa kavuşmaktadır

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: An ecchymosis (bruise) refers to the skin discoloration caused by the escape of blood into the tissues from ruptured blood vessels. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to bruising. The corresponding phenotypic abnormality is generally elicited on medical history as a report of frequent ecchymoses or bruising without adequate trauma.

definition.value: An ecchymosis is defined as being larger than 1 cm in size.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0000979 (Purpura)  ; abnormality of the integument ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system ; abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues

value.value: "Purpura (z latinského purpura, což znamená ""fialový"") je přítommnost červených nebo fialových skvrn na kůži, které neblednou po použití tlaku. Jsou způsobené krvácením pod kůži. Tento termín se odkazuje na abnormálně zvýšenou náchylnost ke vzniku purpury. Skvrny u purpura jsou větší než petechie"

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Purpura (from Latin: purpura, meaning purple) is the appearance of red or purple discolorations on the skin that do not blanch on applying pressure. They are caused by bleeding underneath the skin. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing purpura. Purpura are larger than petechiae.

value.value: Purpura (Latince'den purpura, mor manasında) basınç uygulamak ile soluklaşmayan deri üzerindeki kırmızı veya mor görünümdür. Deri altına kanama ile oluşmaktadır. Bu terim anormal şekilde purpura gelişimi için artmış yatkınlığa işaret etmektedir. Purpura peteşiden daha büyüktür

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Purpura (from Latin: purpura, meaning purple) is the appearance of red or purple discolorations on the skin that do not blanch on applying pressure. They are caused by bleeding underneath the skin. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing purpura. Purpura are larger than petechiae.

value.value: Purpura (from Latin: purpura, meaning purple) is the appearance of red or purple discolorations on the skin that do not blanch on applying pressure. They are caused by bleeding underneath the skin. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing purpura. Purpura are larger than petechiae.

definition.value: Depending on their size, purpuric lesions are traditionally classified as petechiae (pinpoint hemorrhages less than 2 mm in greatest diameter), purpura (2 mm to 1 cm) or ecchymoses (more than 1 cm).

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0000992 (Cutaneous photosensitivity)  ; abnormality of the integument

value.value: An increased sensitivity of the skin to light. Photosensitivity may result in a rash upon exposure to the sun (which is known as photodermatosis). Photosensitivity can be diagnosed by phototests in which light is shone on small areas of skin.

Derinin ışığa artmış hassaslığı. Fotosensitivite güneşe maruziyet (fotodermatozis) sonrası döküntü ile sonuçlanabilir. Fotosensitiviteye derinin küçük alanlarına ışık tutulması şeklinde olan fototestler ile tanı konabilir

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: An increased sensitivity of the skin to light. Photosensitivity may result in a rash upon exposure to the sun (which is known as photodermatosis). Photosensitivity can be diagnosed by phototests in which light is shone on small areas of skin.

value.value: Zvýšená citlivost kůže na světlo. Fotosenzitivita může vést ke vzniku vyrážky po expozici slunci (známé jako fotodermatóza). Fotosenzitivita může být diagnostikována pomocí fototestů, ve kterých se světlem svítí na malé oblasti kůže

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: An increased sensitivity of the skin to light. Photosensitivity may result in a rash upon exposure to the sun (which is known as photodermatosis). Photosensitivity can be diagnosed by phototests in which light is shone on small areas of skin.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0000995 (Melanocytic nevus)  ; abnormality of the integument

value.value: A oval and round, colored (usually medium-to dark brown, reddish brown, or flesh colored) lesion. Typically, a melanocytic nevus is less than 6 mm in diameter, but may be much smaller or larger.

Oval ve yuvarlak, renkli (çoğunlukla orta koyu kahverengiden, kırmızımsı kahverengiye veya ten rengi) bir lezyon. Tipik olarak, melanositik nevüs çapı 6 mm'den daha azdır fakat daha küçük veya daha büyük olabilir

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A oval and round, colored (usually medium-to dark brown, reddish brown, or flesh colored) lesion. Typically, a melanocytic nevus is less than 6 mm in diameter, but may be much smaller or larger.

value.value: Oválné a kulaté, barevné (obvykle středně až tmavě hnědé, červenohnědé, nebo tělové barvy) léze. Typicky, melanocytární nevus je menší než 6 mm v průměru, ale může být i mnohem menší nebo větší

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A oval and round, colored (usually medium-to dark brown, reddish brown, or flesh colored) lesion. Typically, a melanocytic nevus is less than 6 mm in diameter, but may be much smaller or larger.

definition.value: Melanocytic nevi are commonly known as moles. The majority of moles appear during the first 20 to 30 years of a person's life, however, some may be present when the baby is born. The average human has from 10 to 14 moles. Moles can develop on the scalp, under the nails, armpits, virtually anywhere on the body. The total number of moles a person can have usually varies during his or her lifetime.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001009 (Telangiectasia)  ; abnormality of the integument ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system

value.value: Telangektázie jsou drobné, dilatované cévy nacházející se v blízkosti povrchu kůže nebo sliznic, o průměru mezi 0,5 a 1 milimetrů. Telangektázie se nachází zejména na jazyku, rtech, patře, prstech a konečcích prstů, tváři, spojivkách, trupu, nehtových lůžkach

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Telangiectasias refer to small dilated blood vessels located near the surface of the skin or mucous membranes, measuring between 0.5 and 1 millimeter in diameter. Telangiectasia are located especially on the tongue, lips, palate, fingers, face, conjunctiva, trunk, nail beds, and fingertips.

value.value: Telangiectasias refer to small dilated blood vessels located near the surface of the skin or mucous membranes, measuring between 0.5 and 1 millimeter in diameter. Telangiectasia are located especially on the tongue, lips, palate, fingers, face, conjunctiva, trunk, nail beds, and fingertips.

Telenjiektazi deri veya mukoz membran yüzeyine yakın yerleşmiş 0.5 ve 1 milimetre çap arasında ölçülen küçük, genişlemiş kan damarlarına denmektedir. Telenjiektaziler özellikle dil, dudaklar, parmaklar, yüz, konjunktiva, gövde, tırnak yatakları ve parmak uçlarında yer alır

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Telangiectasias refer to small dilated blood vessels located near the surface of the skin or mucous membranes, measuring between 0.5 and 1 millimeter in diameter. Telangiectasia are located especially on the tongue, lips, palate, fingers, face, conjunctiva, trunk, nail beds, and fingertips.

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: The presence of multiple lipomas (a type of benign tissue made of fatty tissue).

definition.value: A lipoma is a benign tumor composed of fatty tissue. They are the most common form of soft tissue tumor and are usually soft to the touch, movable, and generally painless (but there is a separate entity of painful multiple lipomas which is a hereditary disease called Dercum disease or adiposis dolorosa). Many lipomas are small (under one centimeter diameter) but can enlarge to sizes greater than six centimeters. Lipomas are commonly found in adults from 40 to 60 years of age, but can also be found in children.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001013 (Eruptive xanthomas)  ; abnormality of the integument

value.value: Eruptive xanthomas are yellow-orange-to-red-brown papules that are often surrounded by an erythematous halo. They appear in crops on the buttocks, extensor surfaces of the extremities, and flexural creases. Acutely, variable amounts of pruritus and pain occur.

Eruptivní xantomy jsou žluto-oranžovo-červeno-hnědé papuly, často obklopené erytematózním kruhovým okrskem kůže. Objevují se na hýždích, extensorových površích končetin, a flexorových záhybech. Akutně je doprovází variabilní svědění a bolest

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Eruptive xanthomas are yellow-orange-to-red-brown papules that are often surrounded by an erythematous halo. They appear in crops on the buttocks, extensor surfaces of the extremities, and flexural creases. Acutely, variable amounts of pruritus and pain occur.

value.value: Erüptif ksantomlar sıklıkla eritamatöz hale ile çevrelenmiş sarı-kavun içiden kırmızı-kahverengiye değişen papüllerdir. Basenlerde, ekstremitelerin ekstensör yüzeylerinde ve fleksural kıvrımlarında meydana gelir. Akut olarak, değişen derecelerde pruritus ve ağrı oluşur

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Eruptive xanthomas are yellow-orange-to-red-brown papules that are often surrounded by an erythematous halo. They appear in crops on the buttocks, extensor surfaces of the extremities, and flexural creases. Acutely, variable amounts of pruritus and pain occur.

definition.value: Eruptive xanthomas occur in the setting of chylomicronemia and hypertriglyceridemia.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001014 (Angiokeratoma)  ; abnormality of the integument ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system

value.value: Angiokeratomas are hyperkeratotic papules that are characterized histologically by superficial ectatic (i.e., dilated) blood vessels with epidermal proliferation. Clinically, angiokeratoma presents as a small, raised, dark-red spot.

Cévní léze definovaná histologicky jako jedna nebo více dilatovaných krevních cév ležících přímo subepidermálně a vykazující epidermální proliferativní reakci. Klinicky se angiokeratom manifestuje jako malé, zvýšené, tmavě červené místo

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Angiokeratomas are hyperkeratotic papules that are characterized histologically by superficial ectatic (i.e., dilated) blood vessels with epidermal proliferation. Clinically, angiokeratoma presents as a small, raised, dark-red spot.

value.value: Direk subepidermal olarak yer alan ve epidermal proliferatif reaksiyon gösteren vasküler bir lezyon bir veya birden fazla genişlemiş kan damarı olarak histolojik olarak tanımlanır. Klinik olarak, anjiyokeratoma küçük, zeminden yükselmiş, koyu kırmızı nokta olarak ortaya çıkar

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Angiokeratomas are hyperkeratotic papules that are characterized histologically by superficial ectatic (i.e., dilated) blood vessels with epidermal proliferation. Clinically, angiokeratoma presents as a small, raised, dark-red spot.

definition.value: Angiokeratomas occur clinically as 1 of 5 different subtypes.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001019 (Erythroderma)  ; abnormality of the integument ; abnormality of the immune system

value.value: An inflammatory exfoliative dermatosis involving nearly all of the surface of the skin. Erythroderma develops suddenly. A patchy erythema may generalize and spread to affect most of the skin. Scaling may appear in 2-6 days and be accompanied by hot, red, dry skin, malaise, and fever.

Neredeyse bütün deri yüzeyini içeren inflamatuvar eksfoliyatif dermatozis. Eritroderma aniden gelişir. Yama eritroderması genele yayılıp derinin çoğunu etkileyebilir. Soyulma 2-6 gün içinde ortaya çıkabilir ve sıcak, kırmızı, kuru deri, halsizlik ve ateş eşlik eder

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: An inflammatory exfoliative dermatosis involving nearly all of the surface of the skin. Erythroderma develops suddenly. A patchy erythema may generalize and spread to affect most of the skin. Scaling may appear in 2-6 days and be accompanied by hot, red, dry skin, malaise, and fever.

value.value: Zánětlivá exfoliativní dermatitida zahrnující téměř veškerý povrch kůže. Erytrodermie se vyvíjí náhle. Okrskový erytém se může rozšířit a postihnout většinu kůže. Olupování kůže se mohou objevit po 2-6 dnech, olupující kůže je teplá, červená, suchá, z celkových příznaků se může objevit nevolnost a horečka

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: An inflammatory exfoliative dermatosis involving nearly all of the surface of the skin. Erythroderma develops suddenly. A patchy erythema may generalize and spread to affect most of the skin. Scaling may appear in 2-6 days and be accompanied by hot, red, dry skin, malaise, and fever.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001028 (Hemangioma)  ; neoplasm ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system

value.value: A hemangioma is a benign tumor characterized by blood-filled spaces lined by benign endothelial cells. A hemangioma characterized by large endothelial spaces (caverns) is called a cavernous hemangioma (in contrast to a hemangioma with small endothelial spaces, which is called capillary hemangioma).

Hemangiom je benigní nádor tvořený krví naplněnými prostory lemovanými endoteliálními buňkami. Hemangiom s velkými endoteliálními prostory (kavernami) se nazývá kavernózní hemangiom (na rozdíl od hemangiomu s malými endoteliálními prostory, který se nazývá kapilární hemangiom)

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A hemangioma is a benign tumor characterized by blood-filled spaces lined by benign endothelial cells. A hemangioma characterized by large endothelial spaces (caverns) is called a cavernous hemangioma (in contrast to a hemangioma with small endothelial spaces, which is called capillary hemangioma).

value.value: Hemanjiyom kan dolu boşlukların selim endotelyal hücreler tarafından sınırlanması ile karakterize bir selim tümördür. Geniş endotelyal boşluklar (oyuklar) ile karakterize bir hemanjiyom kavernöz hemanjiyom (küçük endotelyal boşluklar ile olan hemanjiyomaya, kapiller hemanjiyoma zıt olarak) olarak adlandırılır

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A hemangioma is a benign tumor characterized by blood-filled spaces lined by benign endothelial cells. A hemangioma characterized by large endothelial spaces (caverns) is called a cavernous hemangioma (in contrast to a hemangioma with small endothelial spaces, which is called capillary hemangioma).

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001029 (Poikiloderma)  ; abnormality of the integument

value.value: 多形皮膚萎縮症 (ポイキロデルマ)
Poikiloderma (1) ağımsı hipopigmentasyon ve hiperpigmentasyon, (2) epidermal atrofiye ikincil kırışıklık ve (3) telenjiektaziler ile birlikte deri yamasına denmektedir

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Poikiloderma refers to a patch of skin with (1) reticulated hypopigmentation and hyperpigmentation, (2) wrinkling secondary to epidermal atrophy, and (3) telangiectasias.

value.value: Poikiloderma refers to a patch of skin with (1) reticulated hypopigmentation and hyperpigmentation, (2) wrinkling secondary to epidermal atrophy, and (3) telangiectasias.
Poikiloderma znamená okrsek kůže s (1) mřížkovanou hypopigmentací a hyperpigmentací, (2) svraštěním navazujícím na atrofii epidermis a (3) teleangiektáziemi

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Poikiloderma refers to a patch of skin with (1) reticulated hypopigmentation and hyperpigmentation, (2) wrinkling secondary to epidermal atrophy, and (3) telangiectasias.

definition.value: Poikiloderma does not refer to a specific disease entity, but can be seen owing to a number of different causes. See Figure 2 of PMID:32363096.
